title: Ticket #6152: Job submitter crash if submit requirements or transforms fail
description:
During job submission, if a submit requirement or transform fails, the schedd will send a serialized CondorError object describing the error. The client API functions (RemoteCommitTransaction(), DisconnectQ()) take an optional CondorError pointer, which receives the deserialized error data. This parameter defaults to NULL. But the pointer is always dereferenced when error data is received. Most callers of the client functions don't pass a non-NULL pointer.

This was observed on a LIGO machine, where the Job Router repeatedly crashed when the routed job violated a submit requirement.
